c74object.name: dynamicdsp~
c74object.digest: Dynamic patch management and advanced audio multithreading
c74object.description: dynamicdsp~ is a multithreaded audio processing object for dynamically loading and managing audio (or non-audio) patches in realtime, without affecting other patches that are processing. It can be thought of as a poly~ alternative, with more extensive multithreading and dynamic loading and routing features, but lacking some of the other features of poly~ (such as down and up sampling). There is an associated set of objects for audio input / output and querying and setting patch state (dynamic.in~ / dynamic.out~ / dynamic.request~ / dynamic.this~ / dynamic.patch~).

objarg.name: patch_name
objarg.description: The first argument sets the inital patch to load by setting its name as a symbol. This will only load one instance of the patch.

objarg.name: inlets/outlets
objarg.digest: Set the number of inlets and outlets
objarg.description:
If you wish to declare a number of inlets /outlets different from the default, the next arguments should be a set of up to 4 ints to set:
number of signal inlets (shared with message inlets)
number of signal outlets
number of message inlets (shared with signal inlets)
number of message outlets

objarg.name: args
objarg.digest: Set arguments for the loaded patch
objarg.description: If you wish to provide arguments to the loaded patch then the next argument should be the symbol "args" followed by up to 10 arguments to the patch. These are applied only to the patch loaded at instantiation.

method.name: message
method.description: A message can be sent into any of the message inlets specified by the message inlets argument. This will be sent to all targeted slots in parallel. The message should be recieved by an in (matching the inlet it was sent to) inside the loaded patch.

method.name: signal
method.description: A signal can be sent into any of the signal inlets specified by the signal inlets argument. This will be sent to all available slots in parallel. The signal should be recieved by a dynamic.in~ or dynamic.request~ (matching the inlet it was sent to) inside the loaded patch.

method.name: activethreads
method.digest: Set the number of active threads
method.description: The activethreads message followed by an int can be used to set the number of active threads. This is inernally limited to the number of cores available on the hardware.

method.name: autoloadbalance
method.description:
The autoloadbalance message followed by an int can be used to switch automatic load balancing on(1)/off(0) (defaults to off).
When on, each patch runs on whichever thread becomes available to process it first. When off, each patch is linked statically to a thread, as determined by the threadmap.
Automatic load balancing has slightly more overhead, but may result in better cpu usage in siuations where the processing load of each patch is varying in an unpredicatble way, or when there are other changing demands on the hardware. The ideal situation is for all threads to be under equal load to give the most efficient use of cpu power.

method.name: clear
method.description: Sending the clear message will clear all the currently occupied slots within the dynamicdsp~.

method.name: deletepatch
method.digest: Delete a patch from a specific slot
method.description: Sending the deletepatch message followed by an int will delete the patch from that slot within the dynamicdsp~.

method.name: loadpatch
method.digest: Load a patch into a free slot
method.description:
The loadpatch message is used to load a patch into dynamicdsp~. Patches are loaded by sending messages to the object. Each patch is loaded into a slot which can be refered to by index number (from 1). The index number of the slot is available within the hosted patch using either the dynamic.this~ or dynamic.patch~ objects.
To load a patch into the next free slot, the loadpatch message can be followed by the name of a patch to load as a symbol.
Two optional ints before the name of the patch can be used to specify the slot in which to load the patch (replacing any patch already loaded in that slot) followed by the audio processing thread to assign the patch to.
Additional ints can be specified after the name of the patch to pass as arguments to the patch to be loaded.
Each slot in dynamicdsp~ can contain a different patch by changing the patch name in the loadpatch message.

method.name: multithread
method.description:
The multithread message followed by an int can be used to switch multithreading on(1)/off(0).
multithread defaults to on unless nested - these default to off
Multithreading will add a small cpu overhead, so in some situations it may not produce any gain. In others the gain will be significant.

method.name: open
method.description: Sending the open message followed by an int will open that specific patch window from inside dynamicdsp~ provided that there is a patch there.

method.name: target
method.description:
Similarily to poly~, the target message followed by an int will set inputs to target a specific patch.
default is target 0 (target all patches).

method.name: targetfree
method.description:
The targetfree message by itself will set inputs to target any free patch.
Up to two ints can follow the message to set specific patches to target when they are free.
One int sets the maximum patch to target, with the minumum being the first patch.
Ex. targetfree 5 targets any free patch between slots 1 and 5 (inclusive).
Two ints sets the minimum and maximum patches to target.
Ex. targetfree 3 9 targets any free patch between slots 3 and 9 (inclusive).

method.name: threadmap
method.digest: Set the thread on which to process a particular patch
method.description:
The threadmap message is followed by two ints, the first specifies a patch, the second says which thread to process on.
Threads are wrapped around to the number of active threads. This means that a suitable thread map for a larger number of cores should transfer reasonably well to a lower number of threads (but not vice versa).
The default mapping is for each patch to be assigned to a thread of the same number as the slot it is in. Thus each subsequent slot is assigned to be processed on a subsequent thread.
The threadmap can be adjusted in real-time without interrupting audio processing.

method.name: wclose
method.description: Sending the wclose message followed by an int will close that specific patch window provided that it was open.

entry.name: signal
entry.description:
The number of outputs is specified by the signal outputs and message outputs arguments. signals and messages will each have their own outlets instead of sharing like they do with inlets.
The outputs are signals/messages from the patches loaded into dynamicdsp processed in parallel. dynamic.out~ and out should be used within the loaded dynamicdsp~ patch to determine which outlet to output from.
